content: <unnawut> I just realized we don't have any metrics on pq signature signing & verification yet so I'm submitting as a PR to leanMetrics here: https://github.com/leanEthereum/leanMetrics/pull/6

author: bridge-bot
content: <unnawut> Also since signature size is a concern should we also track network throughput as well?

author: bridge-bot
content: <salakhiev> If needed we can measure attestations propagation in devnet1 for different number of validators and different bandwidths using shadow

author: bridge-bot
content:
<katya_rz> re: **@unnawut**
> I just realized we don't have any metrics on pq signature signing & verification yet so I'm submitting as a PR to leanMetrics here: https://github.com/leanEthereum/leanMetrics/pull/6
Does it make sense to measure the size in bytes of a signed attestation? I think it's also good to know

author: bridge-bot
content: <salakhiev> I think it has a fixed size. So probably having a metric for that is overkill

author: bridge-bot
content:
<katya_rz> re: **@unnawut**
> Also since signature size is a concern should we also track network throughput as well?
This one is tricky but important. What comes into my mind is outbound/inbound gossip messages size. But probably not enough. Can we measure it using libp2p metrics/methods? @salakhiev you might know more about it.

author: bridge-bot
content: <salakhiev> We do snappy compression for all messages (before gossip)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<katya_rz> re: **@salakhiev**
> We do snappy compression for all messages (before gossip)
When receiving messages, there will be duplicated ones as well. For throughput we need to measure all of them.
